job_description: Principal Data Scientist - job post Toyota 110 reviews Plano, TX 75024 • Hybrid remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview Who we are At Toyota, we are reimagining mobility through innovative, high-quality technology solutions designed to enhance lives and meet our company mission of “Producing Happiness for All.” If you are interested in reimagining mobility with us in an inclusive environment built on teamwork that puts respect for people first, we want to talk to you. Who we’re looking for Toyota’s Information Technology Experiences (ITx) organization is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Sr. Data Scientist for the Office of Data Science and Automation (ODSA), Data & Analytics department. The primary responsibility of this role is to serve as a technical domain expert in machine learning (ML), guiding machine learning architectural design decisions, developing and reviewing model and application code, and ensuring high availability and performance of our machine learning applications. Reporting to the Chief Data Scientist/VP Data and Analytics, the person in this role will support the Data and Analytics department's objective to recast its relationship with business functions from a provider of technology to a business partner capable of innovating business practices through the delivery of technology services and data science. What you’ll be doing Drive the creation, delivery, and evolution of ML models and software components that enable state-of-the-art intelligent systems, working in collaboration with the Business, Data, Product, Architecture, Engineering, and Cloud teams. Lead large-scale ML initiatives with customer needs in mind. Leverage cloud-based architectures and technologies to deliver optimized ML models at scale. Use programming languages like Python, PySpark, or Scala. Promote best practices in all aspects of the engineering and modeling lifecycles. This position is based in Plano, Texas. Toyota encourages all employees to live within a reasonable commuting distance of their assigned work location. Hybrid work from outside the assigned work location may be permitted in a pre-approved list of states with certain stipulations. Speak with your Recruiter and the Hiring Manager to learn more about our hybrid work program. What you bring Master’s degree or higher in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a similar technical field. Experience designing and building data-intensive predictive analytics/machine learning solutions in a distributed production environment. Experience programming with Python, PySpark, and/or Scala. Experience with the full Machine Learning development lifecycle using modern technology in a business-critical setting. Experience with database query languages such as SQL, Hive, and Pig. Applied statistical experience, including knowledge of statistical tests, distributions, regression, maximum likelihood estimators, etc. Added bonus if you have Doctoral degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a similar technical field. Java or C++ experience. Working experience in the automotive or manufacturing industry. Experience partnering with technology peers responsible for data architecture and distributed computing infrastructure/platforms. Experience in AWS, GCP, or Azure cloud platforms. Data Wrangling experience, including the ability to transform raw data into more readily used formats. What we’ll bring During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include: A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect. Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement. Vehicle purchase & lease programs. Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family. Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable). Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute. Paid holidays and paid time off. Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more. Flexible spending accounts. Relocation assistance (if applicable). To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time. Belonging at Toyota Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. Have a question or need assistance with your application? Check out the How to Apply section of our careers page on Toyota.com or send an email to talent.acquisition@toyota.com.

Senior Data Scientist - job post ProIT Inc. Dallas, TX $98,864 - $150,541 a year -  Full-time Responded to 51-74% of applications in the past 30 days, typically within 16 days. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $98,864 - $150,541 a year Job Type Full-time Responsibilities : Support/lead Data Science projects for Banking and Financial Services clients - Understand a problem statement and implement analytical solutions/ techniques independently or with minimal supervision - Build relevant use cases for business - Connect with business, Teams on various use cases, identify AI/ML solutions to help business processes and implement them - Develop analytical models leveraging appropriate Machine Learning, Deep Learning techniques - Connect to different data sources and extract data, handle large datasets for analysis - Work on structured and unstructured data for analysis - Interact with different teams (Business, Data, IT teams etc.) for project related requirements - Communicate results to key stakeholders - Provide necessary support for model deployment - Guide team members on model building and appropriate techniques. Qualifications: · Master’s Degree in Statistics/Finance/Economics/Mathematics/MBA/Engineering or PhD · 10+ yrs in Data Science, development of Analytical models for Banking and Financial Services clients inclusive of Analytics Strategy, Architecture and Roadmap · Hands on experience in Python/R/Pyspark, Scala, SQL , other analytical tools etc. · Experience and knowledge in various Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Text Mining techniques · Knowledge of the end-to-end cycle from understanding business problem, data discovery and extraction, model development and evaluation, to production deployment · Experience in areas of Marketing /Risk/Operations · Knowledge of Banking and Financial Services · Experience in GCP/Azure/AWS would be advantageous · Understanding of MLOps would be good to have · Good communications skills · Ability & willingness to multi-task, prioritize, and work effectively under pressure and ensure adherence to Service levels & targets Job Type: Full-time Pay: $98,864.25 - $150,540.81 per year Benefits: Health insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Experience: Data science: 10 years (Preferred) Python/R/Pyspark,: 10 years (Preferred) Machine learning: 10 years (Preferred) Work Location: On the road Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Sr Data Scientist - job post CBRE 4,202 reviews Richardson, TX 75082 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Posted 15-Mar-2023 Service line GWS Segment Role type Full-time Areas of Interest Data & Analytics Location(s) Richardson - Texas - United States of America Job summary Partnering with the Principal Data Scientist, this role will involve developing ML models to infer and learn from (un)structured data. Essential duties and responsibilities Works/leads on complex, cross-functional research or analytical projects demonstrating advanced computational algorithms. Develops custom algorithms for solving sophisticated real estate business problems across a wealth of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources. Drives quick and sturdy business insights using standard tools and frameworks, potentially across various tech stacks including Open Source Acts as a frontline consult to trigger thinking to solve business problems Wraps data insights into narratives with visualizations, with special focus on Interpretable/ Explainable Machine Learning and Causal Inference Technical and Other Skills Demonstrable experience in Supervised and Unsupervised learning – from Regression, Forecasting, Classification, to NLP, Decision and Search Algorithms. Specialization in one significant ML sub-discipline like NLP or Optimization is encouraged. Explainable understanding of Optimization algorithms and their implementation in at least one programming language. Strong coding skills in R and Python; and scripting in SQL and MS Excel. Any other relevant programming language skills like Java, Scala, Julia, etc. Supervisory Responsibilities No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each crucial duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and Experience Must have between 4-6 years of impactful experience in creating Data-driven products and productizing ML models, while being mindful of Data pipelines. Bachelor's in fields such as Mathematics (Pure/ Applied), Statistics, Computer Science/ Engineering, Information Systems or any other Scientific field – along with proven experience. Or a Masters/ PhD with lesser, but applicable, experience is also welcomed. Certificates and/or License Data Scientist Certification or equivalent combination of experience and/or education. Communication skills Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret the most complex business documents. Ability to respond optimally to the most critical issues. Ability to write reports, manuals, speeches and articles using distinctive style. Ability to make effective and persuasive presentations on complex topics to employees, clients, top management and/or public groups. Ability to motivate and negotiate effectively with key employees, top management, and client groups to take desired action. Financial Knowledge Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. Reasoning ability Ability to solve advanced problems and deal with a variety of options in complex situations. Requires expert level analytical and quantitative skills with proven experience in developing strategic solutions for a growing matrix-based multi-industry sales environment. Draws upon the analysis of others and makes recommendations that have a direct impact on the company. Other skills and/or Abilities Demonstrated knowledge of R and/or Python, together with SQL. Demonstrated knowledge of standard machine learning algorithms, based on “An Introduction to Statistical Learning” by James et. al. or similar textbook. Demonstrated knowledge of strengths, weaknesses, and real-world performance of the ML algorithms. Demonstrated knowledge of web scrapping and data preprocessing. Scope of responsibility Decisions made with in-depth understanding and interpretation of procedures, company policies and business practices to achieve general results. Responsible for setting department deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause long-term impact to co-workers, supervisor, department and/or line of business. #INDSJ CBRE is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. We also provide reasonable accommodations, as needed, throughout the job application process. If you have a disability that inhibits your ability to apply for a position through our online application process, you may contact us via email at recruitingaccommodations@cbre.com or via telephone at +1 866 225 3099 (U.S.) and +1 866 388 4346 (Canada). NOTE: Some, but not all, of our positions may have an additional requirement to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing. If you have questions about the requirement(s) for this position, please inform your Recruiter. CBRE GWS CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) works with clients to make real estate a meaningful contributor to organizational productivity and performance. Our account management model is at the heart of our client-centric approach to delivering integrated real estate solutions. Each client is entrusted with a dedicated leader and is supported by regional and global resources, leveraging the industry's most robust platform. CBRE GWS delivers consistent, measurably superior outcomes for our clients at every stage of the lifecycle, and across industries and geographies.

Director of Commercial Data Science - job post PepsiCo 18,123 reviews Plano, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview This is a role for a director of Data Science responsible to deliver data science and analytics capabilities for consumer metrics in the areas of predictive measurement underneath the global commercial data science. This role will be accountable for ROI Engine within PepsiCo. This includes data feature engineering to prepare data at scale for predictive and optimization models, ensuring that ML models and other data science artifacts conform to predefined standards, productionization and deployable models in PepsiCo’s analytical platforms. This role will also ensure sharing and application of best practices for design using standard tools while supporting advancing the state of the art in data science. This role will have responsibility of managing existing models (media mix modeling, predictive sales predictions, etc) and testing new methodologies for global deployment. It is important to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery of solutions and products, satisfying product requirements while adhering to Data+Analytics and other PepsiCo architecture and technology standards, as applicable. This role will collaborate closely with D+A Data Management Organization, Digital Products and Services Business Engagement and Product leads and global and sector stakeholders as needed regarding execution of product development workstreams and strategic alignment across programs to ensure maximum reusability of analytical assets created by the Data Science and application of best practices in delivering data science products. Responsibilities Lead a team of Data Scientists in the application of modern data science and machine learning principles to address a wide range of business problems across various functional groups within PepsiCo Define project roadmaps and manage project flow to ensure timely delivery of impactful products Provide critical thought leadership to enhance organizational capabilities by utilizing big and small data; work with business leaders and strategic partners to identify and execute on opportunities for enhancement Act as the technical representative for PepsiCo’s Data Science organization Lead delivery of key consumer data priorities within time and budget, particularly around feature engineering, deploying and sustaining ML / AI models Ensure on time and on budget delivery which satisfies product requirements, while adhering to D+A standards. Manage work intake, prioritization and release timing; balancing demand and available resources. Ensure tactical product releases are aligned with the strategic vision and business needs Accountable for work intake supporting implementation, deployment and initial support of data science components in strategic project investments, and resulting business value Accountable for application of common ML scaling and refactoring approaches to ensure that products that are built by Data Scientists can scale to meet the requirements of sectors, service level agreements of execution and expected user experience Partners with Strategy and Transformation Data+Analytics and Digital Product & Services leads, global functional business leads and users, and Sector Leads to ensure that data science products meet business strategies, support S&T direction, and drive business value Lead a team of employee and contract resources to meet product delivery needs, ensuring that strategic direction and knowledge are kept in PepsiCo for future work Set priorities for the team to ensure task completion Hold team accountable for milestone deliverables Continue the build-up of the team including roles for workstream leaderships and machine learning/optimization engineers Manage partnership with talent sourcing vendors Partner with technology vendors as needed Drive the use and application of D+A standards including frameworks, analytical toolkits, data science workbenches and MLOps tool chains and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business Actively participate in collaboration across S&T’s digital hubs across Dallas, Barcelona and other S&T locations (e.g. Hyderabad-India, Mexico) Qualifications Master’s Degree in Data Science or equivalent, Ph.D. Preferred 10 years of relevant work experience, 8 years with a Ph.D. At least 4 years of software development and machine learning experience in a business environment Experience leading technical teams Expert in mathematical models underlying data science methods especially Kalman Filter Demonstrated ability to effectively and concisely communicate with both business and technical audiences 3-5+ years of experience leading/building advanced analytics and big data solutions 2-3+ years managing large virtual teams - experience managing large global teams preferred Knowledge of the data science art (feature engineering, modeling, AI capabilities, optimizers) and related technologies (cloud computing, open source analytical capabilities) Demonstrated ability to drive innovative solutions using data science, feature engineering and machine learning Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization Demonstrated flexibility to manage resources to plan, including effectively handling spikes in demand Solves highly complex problems across teams Strong people management skills with the ability to develop teams and cultivate talent, including teams composed of various experience levels Experience with consumer datasets and marketing data preferred COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Senior Data Engineer - SFL Scientific - job post Deloitte 11,488 reviews Dallas, TX 75201 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Senior Data Engineer SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business practice brings together several key capabilities to architect integrated programs that transform our clients' businesses, including Strategic Growth Transformation, Transformation Strategy & Design, Technology Strategy & Business Transformation, and AI & Data Strategy. Professionals will serve as trusted advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear data-driven choices about where to play and how to win - ultimately driving growth and enterprise value. We are hiring a Senior Data Engineer to support the design and develop solutions for various organizations looking to implement tools, software, and processes that support machine learning and AI initiatives across healthcare, life sciences, manufacturing, energy, and other sectors. Work you'll do As a Senior Data Engineer you work cross-functionally with data scientists, machine learning engineers, project managers, and industry experts to develop robust AI infrastructure and deployment services for our novel machine learning applications. Key to this role is the ability to demonstrate expertise in cloud deployment, DevOps, MLOps, data engineering, and streamlining IT infrastructure processes for organizations across a wide variety of industries. In our consultative approach, we are platform agnostic and are committed to providing the best technical solutions for each client and solution. Our engineering team leverages emerging technologies across cloud, HPC, DevOps, and MLOps to create solutions and products that address complex issues and business problems faced by global organizations to include cancer detection, drug discovery, optimizing population health and clinical trials, autonomous systems and edge AI, and renewable energy. Join us to expand your technical career through the lens of consulting and work on many novel projects and use cases to expand your data science & AI skills. Work with clients to design, develop, and deploy new architectures for machine learning & automation applications such as ELT functions, HPC/compute infrastructure, AWS/Azure solutions, database solutions, and optimization of DevOps procedures Leverage skills in modern data architecture, cloud engineering, data transformation, and management of structured and unstructured data sources Support and enhance data architecture, and data pipelines, and define database schemas (Graph DB, SQL, NoSQL) to support algorithm scalability and deployment based on agile business priorities and technology initiatives Participate in architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment, security, and high availability in the cloud or on-prem Adopt and maintain best engineering practices in automation, HPC, CI/CD, and AIOps The Team SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business, is a data science professional services practice focused on strategy, technology, and solving business challenges with Artificial Intelligence (AI). The team has a proven track record serving large, market-leading organizations in the private and public sectors, successfully delivering high-quality, novel and complex projects, and offering deep domain and scientific capabilities. Made up of experienced AI strategists, data scientists, and AI engineers, they serve as trusted advisors to executives, helping them understand and evaluate new and essential areas for AI investment and identify unique opportunities to transform their businesses. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a STEM field or equivalent experience (Computer Science, Engineering, Physics etc.); Master's degree preferred 4+ years' experience in data engineering, cloud engineering, MLOps, while building highly scalable and secure solutions Proficient in Python, SQL, Shell scripting Experience with distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Dask), cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure), containerization, and supporting analytics libraries Expertise with code management and DevOps tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, etc.) Experience with workflow and data management solutions such as Airflow, Kafka, Glue, etc. Experience designing data architectures and understanding of different types of databases or platforms (relational, NoSQL, graph, etc.) Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to develop novel and efficient solutions Limited immigration sponsorship may be available Ability to travel 10%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve Live within commuting distance to one of Deloitte's consulting offices Preferred Qualifications: Master's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related STEM field AWS/Azure Certifications (AWS/Azure Certified: SysOps Administrator, DevOps Engineer, Solutions Architect). Expertise in designing and scaling IT architectures, data lakes, & database schemas (Graph, SQL, NoSQL), etc. Demonstrated experience launching AI/ML solutions into production environments, such as into cloud or HPC/GPU environments #MonitorDeloitte #DeloitteJobs #StrategyConsulting #DeloitteStrategy #Strategy22 #SFL22
